lines.text: Okay well--it's bad? We're gonna... it's a bad thing? It's just... it's bad? And you want to *sell* this? Okay....
I'm not saying this is wrong, but I'm definitely taking notes for my parole hearing.
Remember when I said I had an MBA? I also had an ethics course. I failed it. But still.
The customers seem... unhappy. But their money seems very happy in our account. Mixed signals.
You know, in some cultures, selling Bad Things is considered... also bad. Just something to think about.
Every time a customer complains, a little piece of my soul withers. Good thing I'm mostly meat and bread.
Our reputation is tanking. This is fine. Everything is fine. *sweats mustard*
People are starting to catch on. Quick, look innocent! You're selling Things! Normal, regular Things!
The reviews are coming in. They're not good. Well, the Things aren't good either, so at least there's consistency.
Well, well, well. If it isn't the consequences of our actions. I knew them once, in business school.
Sometimes I wonder if your mother would be proud of this. Then I remember she asked me to help, not to enable. Oops.
